intro: Eleocharis bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of greenish flowers. It is native to western North America, particularly California and Oregon. Eleocharis bolanderi plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
